dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, we always hear about the Trump family's ambition, right? Like, it's this generational thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, we always hear about the Trump family's ambition, right? Like, it's this generational thing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, from Friedrich, the grandfather, all the way to Donald himself, um, that drive for expansion, it's just, it's undeniable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, from Friedrich, the grandfather, all the way to Donald himself, um, that drive for expansion, it's just, it's undeniable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are what nudged Donald Trumps grandfather Friedrich from Germany to New York to the Klondike gold rush; impelled the presidents father, Fred, to build an apartment empire in Brooklyn and Queens; and pushed Donald into Manhattan skyscrapers and, eventually, the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And that's exactly what we saw when Don Jr. and Eric took the reins after their dad became president. They had these huge plans for new hotel brands.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that's exactly what we saw when Don Jr. and Eric took the reins after their dad became president. They had these huge plans for new hotel brands.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When Trump took office and passed the reins to the fourth generation, his sons Eric and Don Jr. had grand ambitions too. But their planstorm into Americas heartland with two new licensed hotel brandsdied earlier this year after failing to gain traction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but here's the thing, right? Their dad made this pledge: no new international deals while he was in office. That kind of, like, hamstrung them initially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but here's the thing, right? Their dad made this pledge: no new international deals while he was in office. That kind of, like, hamstrung them initially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That forced the kids, hamstrung by their fathers pledge not to expand internationally while in office, to pursue a very un-Trumpian strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So, you'd think they'd slow down, right? But no, this article points out they adopted a very, uh, "Trumpian" strategy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So, you'd think they'd slow down, right? But no, this article points out they adopted a very, uh, Trumpian strategy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That forced the kids, hamstrung by their fathers pledge not to expand internationally while in office, to pursue a very un-Trumpian strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, essentially, meant finding creative ways to keep growing, even if it looked like they were putting on the brakes. Don Jr. even said they'd "resume doing what we do best" once politics were over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, essentially, meant finding creative ways to keep growing, even if it looked like they were putting on the brakes. Don Jr. even said they'd resume doing what we do best once politics were over.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Added Don Jr.: When politics are over, we will resume doing what we do best, which is building the best and most luxurious properties in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But they weren't really waiting, were they? I mean, the article mentions they acquired like $110 million of the president's real estate holdings through these, uh, often high-profile transactions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they weren't really waiting, were they? I mean, the article mentions they acquired like one hundred ten million dollars of the president's real estate holdings through these, uh, often high-profile transactions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since their fathers inauguration, they have sold off $110 million of the presidents real estate holdingsthrough more than 100 tiny transactions that have mostly flown under the radar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And not just acquiring, but also making new deals. The Dominican Republic land purchase? That was, uh, pretty direct, you know, a clear embrace of foreign dealings despite the pledge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And not just acquiring, but also making new deals. The Dominican Republic land purchase? That was, uh, pretty direct, you know, a clear embrace of foreign dealings despite the pledge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the Dominican Republic, the younger Trumps sold a piece of land in January 2018 for $3.2 million. It was the clearest violation of their fathers pledge to do no new foreign deals while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which, by the way, the Trump Organization wouldn't comment on. Shocking, I know.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, by the way, the Trump Organization wouldn't comment on. Shocking, I know.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: (The Trump Organization would not comment for this story.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no surprise there. But it gets even wilder. They're doing business with these "established influencers," people who seem to see an opportunity to, um, enhance the president's pockets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no surprise there. But it gets even wilder. They're doing business with these established influencers, people who seem to see an opportunity to, um, enhance the president's pockets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In other cases, theyve done business with wannabe influencers who seemingly recognized an opportunity to line the presidents pockets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Like the Beverly Hills mansion sale to a company tied to an Indonesian billionaire who's also a Trump business partner. Or the Manhattan penthouse from someone selling access to Chinese officials.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Like the Beverly Hills mansion sale to a company tied to an Indonesian billionaire who's also a Trump business partner. Or the Manhattan penthouse from someone selling access to Chinese officials.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They sold Trumps mansion in Beverly Hills for $13.5 million to a company tied to Indonesian billionaire (and Trump business partner) Hary Tanoesoedibjo. They off-loaded a Manhattan penthouse to a woman who runs a business selling access to Chinese officials.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's just, it's wild. The article says these deals would "turn heads" if the seller were anyone else. But with Trump in the Oval Office, it's just, like, completely normal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just, it's wild. The article says these deals would turn heads if the seller were anyone else. But with Trump in the Oval Office, it's just, like, completely normal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Other deals wouldnt turn heads if the seller were anyone but the president of the United States. With Trump in the Oval Office, however, things can get strange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: 'Normal.' Yeah. And it's not just about buying. They're reinvesting, too. Trump Tower got updates, San Francisco got a facelift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Normal. Yeah. And it's not just about buying. They're reinvesting, too. Trump Tower got updates, San Francisco got a facelift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump Tower got minor updates, a five-story San Francisco office building got a face-lift and the Trumps keep stuffing cash into their money-losing European golf resorts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and don't forget the European golf resorts. They're pouring cash into those. Plus, they bought an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lago, from their own aunt!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and don't forget the European golf resorts. They're pouring cash into those. Plus, they bought an eighteen point five million dollar mansion next to Mar-a-Lago, from their own aunt!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and the Trumps keep stuffing cash into their money-losing European golf resorts. But theyve really made only one new purchase, buying an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lagofrom their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're not just maintaining, they're actively expanding. And, um, also significantly increasing debt, which is how their father built his empire, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're not just maintaining, they're actively expanding. And, um, also significantly increasing debt, which is how their father built his empire, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, the Trump children have been chipping away at the debt that helped build their fathers empire, quietly paying down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, like an estimated $60 million since the inauguration. They've added liabilities in New York, San Francisco... it's a huge push.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, like an estimated sixty million dollars since the inauguration. They've added liabilities in New York, San Francisco... it's a huge push.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In New York, they wiped out roughly $19 million of liabilities at 40 Wall Street, 6 East 57th Street and 502 Park Avenue. In San Francisco, where the president owns 30% of a skyscraper alongside billionaire Steven Roths Vornado Realty Trust, Trumps kids have erased $8 million of his debt.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And that $30 million loan against the Las Vegas tower in late 2016? Possibly for some last-minute campaign donations. It's all just, like, very aggressive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that thirty million dollar loan against the Las Vegas tower in late twenty sixteen? Possibly for some last-minute campaign donations. It's all just, like, very aggressive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In late 2016, Trump took out a $30 million loan against a Las Vegas tower he owns with fellow billionaire Phil Ruffinperhaps freeing up some cash for the candidates $12 million in last-minute campaign donations. After selling dozens of condos in the building, the Trumps repaid that loan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, David Walentas, a Brooklyn billionaire, even said, 'He's very much a real estate developer these days.' Referring to Donald, but also, like, his kids are right there, following suit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, David Walentas, a Brooklyn billionaire, even said, He's very much a real estate developer these days. Referring to Donald, but also, like, his kids are right there, following suit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hes not really a real estate developer anymore, Brooklyn billionaire David Walentas told Forbes earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, it's this constant churn, this expansion, even with the political constraints. It really shows, uh, the Trumpian playbook in full effect.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it's this constant churn, this expansion, even with the political constraints. It really shows, uh, the Trumpian playbook in full effect.
